L:3 A:1 P:0 &lt;296/296h 383/383m 1381e 1753w 20x &lt;ebpp&gt; &lt;t&gt; &lt;bd&gt;&gt; l A dirt path. (road). (Third quarter of the Imperial Spire.) The tread of many a booted foot has flattened the rough earth into a wide path. A few stubborn clumps of weed cling tenaciously to the edge of the area, and a large dusty boulder on the west side of the path is the area's only other defining point. To the north, the remains of a once grand and ancient tree can be seen, marking the center of the arena. Bloated with blood and flesh, a frenzied bloodworm sets its beady eyes on you. Dripping with blood, an inverted pentagram floats in mid-air. Hovering on two scarlet leathery wings, this daemonite seems to have a vicious glint to its eyes. A black ouroboros oscillates endlessly here, staring at you with its many eyes. A black, murky mist has settled here. The shadows bend and contort to the form of this nightmare, red eyes glaring from out of the darkness. You see exits leading north, northeast, south, and northwest. L:3 A:0 P:0 &lt;296/296h 383/383m 1381e 1751w 20x &lt;ebpp&gt; &lt;bd&gt;&gt; who c ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Clark - A grand foyer (7218) - Third quarter of the Imp ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- There are 5 players on this plane and 68 players on other planes. L:3 A:0 P:0 &lt;296/296h 383/383m 1381e 1751w 20x &lt;ebpp&gt; &lt;bd&gt;&gt; s Grasslands near a stream. (First quarter of the Imperial Spire.) Lush grass extends from the walls of the arena itself providing a complete view of the round, inner walls to the very top. An assortment of plants and wildflowers have scattered themselves throughout the area, while colourful butterflies flit through the grass without taking heed of the arena's true purpose. The sound of running water can be heard somewhere in the distance, a testament to the area's lush fertility. You see exits leading north, east, south, and west. L:3 A:0 P:0 &lt;296/296h 383/383m 1381e 1752w 20x &lt;ebpp&gt; &lt;bd&gt;&gt; s A grand foyer. (Third quarter of the Imperial Spire.) A huge, vaulted chamber made of polished gold-veined black marble has been designed to inspire awe in even the most hardened fighter. Across from the large arched entrance is a matching archway with several Stavenn banners made of gold and black satin hanging in rows on both sides. Several large columns throughout the chamber have had the figures of great leaders of Stavenn, past and present, painstakingly chiseled into them in a stylized inverted relief unique to Stavenn's artistic culture. The ceiling has been chiseled with the same craftsmanship that went into the columns and an arena scene with battling competitors and ferocious wild animals can be seen in grand detail above the entry arch. In the center of the expansive room is a grand staircase which rises a few feet into the air before branching off into two staircases that wind slowly upwards towards the southeast and the southwest until they disappear beyond the ceiling. Fangs dripping with what could only be fresh blood, a shadowy figure of a hound stands here, his eyes roving with a calculated glare. The undead form of Myrmidon Clark Nessaja, Curator of Death is here. He wields a dwarven battleaxe in each hand. You see exits leading north, south, down, and a spiral staircase leads to the southeast and southwest. L:3 A:0 P:0 &lt;296/296h 383/383m 1381e 1752w 20x &lt;ebpp&gt; &lt;bd&gt;&gt; nod You nod your head. L:3 A:0 P:0 &lt;296/296h 383/383m 1381e 1752w 20x &lt;ebpp&gt; &lt;bd&gt;&gt; ih "hound164262" a shadow hound "daemonite127100" a small winged daemonite "ouroboros195431" a black ouroboros Number of objects: 3 L:3 A:0 P:0 &lt;296/296h 383/383m 1381e 1752w 20x &lt;ebpp&gt; &lt;bd&gt;&gt; SUMMON HANDS OF THE GRAVE Clark quickly eats a toadstool. L:3 A:0 P:0 &lt;296/296h 383/383m 1381e 1752w 20x &lt;ebpp&gt; &lt;bd&gt;&gt; You mutter words of death and decay, and suddenly the ground breaks open all GRAVEHANDS IN PROCESS around as hands of rotting flesh and white bone push out of the ground. L:3 A:0 P:0 &lt;296/296h 351/383m 1381e 1743w 20x &lt;-bpp&gt; &lt;bd&gt;&gt; (drink mana) You take a drink from a speckled purple vial. Your mind feels rejuvenated. L:3 A:0 P:0 &lt;296/296h 383/383m 1381e 1743w 20x &lt;-bpp&gt; &lt;bd&gt;&gt; essence Your life essence stands at 85%. L:3 A:0 P:0 &lt;296/296h 383/383m 1381e 1743w 20x &lt;-bpp&gt; &lt;bd&gt;&gt; map /--Third quarter of the Imperial Spire.--------v7218--\ | / \ | [ ] | [ ] | | / \ / \ | [ ] \ | / [ ] \ \ | / / \ [ ] / \ | / [ ]-[ ]-[ ] | [*] / | \ [ ] [ ] [ ] | [ ] \--Time: 83 usec--------------------------------------/ L:3 A:0 P:0 &lt;296/296h 383/383m 1381e 1743w 20x &lt;-bpp&gt; &lt;bd&gt;&gt; l A grand foyer. (Third quarter of the Imperial Spire.) A huge, vaulted chamber made of polished gold-veined black marble has been designed to inspire awe in even the most hardened fighter. Across from the large arched entrance is a matching archway with several Stavenn banners made of gold and black satin hanging in rows on both sides. Several large columns throughout the chamber have had the figures of great leaders of Stavenn, past and present, painstakingly chiseled into them in a stylized inverted relief unique to Stavenn's artistic culture. The ceiling has been chiseled with the same craftsmanship that went into the columns and an arena scene with battling competitors and ferocious wild animals can be seen in grand detail above the entry arch. In the center of the expansive room is a grand staircase which rises a few feet into the air before branching off into two staircases that wind slowly upwards towards the southeast and the southwest until they disappear beyond the ceiling. Fangs dripping with what could only be fresh blood, a shadowy figure of a hound stands here, his eyes roving with a calculated glare. Hovering on two scarlet leathery wings, this daemonite seems to have a vicious glint to its eyes. A black ouroboros oscillates endlessly here, staring at you with its many eyes. Hands of rotting flesh and white bone push up from the ground. The undead form of Myrmidon Clark Nessaja, Curator of Death is here. He wields a dwarven battleaxe in each hand. You see exits leading north, south, down, and a spiral staircase leads to the southeast and southwest. L:3 A:0 P:0 &lt;296/296h 383/383m 1381e 1746w 20x &lt;-bpp&gt; &lt;bd&gt;&gt; map /--Third quarter of the Imperial Spire.--------v7218--\ | / \ | [ ] | [ ] | | / \ / \ | [ ] \ | / [ ] \ \ | / / \ [ ] / \ | / [ ]-[ ]-[ ] | [*] / | \ [ ] [ ] [ ] | [ ] \--Time: 85 usec--------------------------------------/ L:3 A:0 P:0 &lt;296/296h 383/383m 1381e 1746w 20x &lt;-bpp&gt; &lt;bd&gt;&gt; l Clark quickly eats a toadstool. L:3 A:0 P:0 &lt;296/296h 383/383m 1381e 1747w 20x &lt;-bpp&gt; &lt;bd&gt;&gt; A grand foyer. (Third quarter of the Imperial Spire.) A huge, vaulted chamber made of polished gold-veined black marble has been designed to inspire awe in even the most hardened fighter. Across from the large arched entrance is a matching archway with several Stavenn banners made of gold and black satin hanging in rows on both sides. Several large columns throughout the chamber have had the figures of great leaders of Stavenn, past and present, painstakingly chiseled into them in a stylized inverted relief unique to Stavenn's artistic culture. The ceiling has been chiseled with the same craftsmanship that went into the columns and an arena scene with battling competitors and ferocious wild animals can be seen in grand detail above the entry arch. In the center of the expansive room is a grand staircase which rises a few feet into the air before branching off into two staircases that wind slowly upwards towards the southeast and the southwest until they disappear beyond the ceiling. Fangs dripping with what could only be fresh blood, a shadowy figure of a hound stands here, his eyes roving with a calculated glare. Hovering on two scarlet leathery wings, this daemonite seems to have a vicious glint to its eyes. A black ouroboros oscillates endlessly here, staring at you with its many eyes. Dripping with blood, an inverted pentagram floats in mid-air. A black, murky mist has settled here. The shadows bend and contort to the form of this nightmare, red eyes glaring from out of the darkness. Hands of rotting flesh and white bone push up from the ground. The undead form of Myrmidon Clark Nessaja, Curator of Death is here. He wields a dwarven battleaxe in each hand. You see exits leading north, south, down, and a spiral staircase leads to the southeast and southwest. L:3 A:0 P:0 &lt;296/296h 383/383m 1381e 1750w 20x &lt;-bpp&gt; &lt;bd&gt;&gt; l A grand foyer. (lost) (Third quarter of the Imperial Spire.) A huge, vaulted chamber made of polished gold-veined black marble has been designed to inspire awe in even the most hardened fighter. Across from the large arched entrance is a matching archway with several Stavenn banners made of gold and black satin hanging in rows on both sides. Several large columns throughout the chamber have had the figures of great leaders of Stavenn, past and present, painstakingly chiseled into them in a stylized inverted relief unique to Stavenn's artistic culture. The ceiling has been chiseled with the same craftsmanship that went into the columns and an arena scene with battling competitors and ferocious wild animals can be seen in grand detail above the entry arch. In the center of the expansive room is a grand staircase which rises a few feet into the air before branching off into two staircases that wind slowly upwards towards the southeast and the southwest until they disappear beyond the ceiling. Fangs dripping with what could only be fresh blood, a shadowy figure of a hound stands here, his eyes roving with a calculated glare. Hovering on two scarlet leathery wings, this daemonite seems to have a vicious glint to its eyes. A black ouroboros oscillates endlessly here, staring at you with its many eyes. Dripping with blood, an inverted pentagram floats in mid-air. A black, murky mist has settled here. The shadows bend and contort to the form of this nightmare, red eyes glaring from out of the darkness. Hands of rotting flesh and white bone push up from the ground. The undead form of Myrmidon Clark Nessaja, Curator of Death is here. He wields a dwarven battleaxe in each hand. You see exits leading north, south, down, and a spiral staircase leads to the southeast and southwest. (anti-weapon field) L:3 A:0 P:0 &lt;296/296h 383/383m 1381e 1750w 20x &lt;ebpp&gt; &lt;bd&gt;&gt; who a ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Ageranu - Grasslands near a stream (7222) - First quarter of the Imp Aoede - An arch-filled clearing (716) - a Portal Room. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- There are 4 players on this plane and 68 players on other planes. L:3 A:0 P:0 &lt;296/296h 383/383m 1381e 1750w 20x &lt;ebpp&gt; &lt;bd&gt;&gt; map path 7222 [Path calculated in: 2173 microseconds.] [Path: n.] L:3 A:0 P:0 &lt;296/296h 383/383m 1381e 1750w 20x &lt;ebpp&gt; &lt;bd&gt;&gt; go (north) L:3 A:0 P:0 &lt;296/296h 383/383m 1381e 1750w 20x &lt;ebpp&gt; &lt;bd&gt;&gt; Grasslands near a stream. (First quarter of the Imperial Spire.) Lush grass extends from the walls of the arena itself providing a complete view of the round, inner walls to the very top. An assortment of plants and wildflowers have scattered themselves throughout the area, while colourful butterflies flit through the grass without taking heed of the arena's true purpose. The sound of running water can be heard somewhere in the distance, a testament to the area's lush fertility. Fangs dripping with what could only be fresh blood, a shadowy figure of a hound stands here, his eyes roving with a calculated glare. Paran Educator, Master Ageranu Vuh'uni, Nightfire Warrior is here. The undead form of Myrmidon Clark Nessaja, Curator of Death is here. He wields a dwarven battleaxe in each hand. You see exits leading north, east, south, and west. L:3 A:0 P:0 &lt;296/296h 383/383m 1381e 1742w 20x &lt;ebpp&gt; &lt;bd&gt;&gt; map /--First quarter of the Imperial Spire.--------v7222--\ | / | \ | | | / | \ | | | / \ | [ ] | [ ] | | / \ / \ | [ ] \ | / [ ] \ \ | / / \ [ ] / \ | / [ ]-[*]-[ ] | [ ] / | \ [ ] [ ] [ ] | [ ] \--Time: 87 usec--------------------------------------/ L:3 A:0 P:0 &lt;296/296h 383/383m 1381e 1742w 20x &lt;ebpp&gt; &lt;bd&gt;&gt; n A dirt path. (road). (Third quarter of the Imperial Spire.) The tread of many a booted foot has flattened the rough earth into a wide path. A few stubborn clumps of weed cling tenaciously to the edge of the area, and a large dusty boulder on the west side of the path is the area's only other defining point. To the north, the remains of a once grand and ancient tree can be seen, marking the center of the arena. Bloated with blood and flesh, a frenzied bloodworm sets its beady eyes on you. A black, murky mist has settled here. You see exits leading north, northeast, south, and northwest. L:3 A:0 P:0 &lt;296/296h 383/383m 1381e 1742w 20x &lt;ebpp&gt; &lt;bd&gt;&gt; ih "bloodworm154723" a frenzied bloodworm "darkness191562" a black murky darkness "ouroboros195431" a black ouroboros Number of objects: 3 L:3 A:0 P:0 &lt;296/296h 383/383m 1381e 1742w 20x &lt;ebpp&gt; &lt;bd&gt;&gt; n Central combat area. (road). (Second quarter of the Imperial Spire.) This simple dirt area comprises the center of the arena. Heavy foot traffic has long since done away with most of the plants which might have once attempted to grow here, although a large, gnarled tree dominates the very center. It stands regally, though apparently dead and blackened for decades, it offers a convenient landmark which can be seen from most other areas of the arena. Buried deep to the hilt, the unmistakable shine of a longsword peaks out of the ground beneath. Blackened with use, bits and pieces of useless armour and weapons lie scattered about the area. Bloated with blood and flesh, a frenzied bloodworm sets its beady eyes on you. You see exits leading north, northeast, east, southeast, south, southwest, west, and northwest. A few stubborn clumps of weed cling tenaciously to the edge of the area, and a large dusty boulder on the west side of the path is the area's only other defining point. To the north, the remains of a once grand and ancient tree can be seen, marking the center of the arena. Bloated with blood and flesh, a frenzied bloodworm sets its beady eyes on you. A black, murky mist has settled here. You see exits leading north, northeast, south, and northwest. (road). (Third quarter of the Imperial Spire.) The tread of many a booted foot has flattened the rough earth into a wide path. A few stubborn clumps of weed cling tenaciously to the edge of the area, and a large dusty boulder on the west side of the path is the area's only other defining point. To the north, the remains of a once grand and ancient tree can be seen, marking the center of the arena. Bloated with blood and flesh, a frenzied bloodworm sets its beady eyes on you. A black, murky mist has settled here. A black ouroboros oscillates endlessly here, staring at you with its many eyes. You see exits leading north, northeast, south, and northwest. L:3 A:0 P:0 &lt;296/296h 370/383m 1381e 1744w 20x &lt;ebpp&gt; &lt;bd&gt;&gt; ne Grassy hills. (Second quarter of the Imperial Spire.) A few small hills and rises roll across the grasslands providing the perfect conditions for conducting sparring combats. The spot is close enough to the forests to provide shelter from the harsh winds, yet not within them to be chilled by their overhanging branches. Although the tall grass has yellowed slightly from the merciless sun, it still provides a soft area in which to fight. The area is ablaze! Bloated with blood and flesh, a frenzied bloodworm sets its beady eyes on you. You see exits leading north, southeast, southwest, and northwest. (road). (Third quarter of the Imperial Spire.) The tread of many a booted foot has flattened the rough earth into a wide path. A few stubborn clumps of weed cling tenaciously to the edge of the area, and a large dusty boulder on the west side of the path is the area's only other defining point. To the north, the remains of a once grand and ancient tree can be seen, marking the center of the arena. Bloated with blood and flesh, a frenzied bloodworm sets its beady eyes on you. A black, murky mist has settled here. Dripping with blood, an inverted pentagram floats in mid-air. The shadows bend and contort to the form of this nightmare, red eyes glaring from out of the darkness. You see exits leading north, northeast, south, and northwest. He is the 45th ranked combatant with a rating of 244. He is the 52nd ranked arena combatant with 25 wins. He is an Aedile in Stavenn. He is a member of the towne of Kragge. He is a member of the clan called 'Krieghexe.' He is a member of the clan called 'Blackmoor.' He is a mentor and able to take on proteges. His warcry is known to be, 'Beware, i'll give you cause to weep.' He is considered to be approximately 125% of your might. He has taken the hand of Lady Ssarlia Nessaja Avrae, Fiery Wytch in marriage. L:3 A:0 P:0 &lt;296/296h 446/383m 1381e 1751w 20x &lt;-bpp&gt; &lt;bd&gt;&gt; l A dirt path. (road). (Third quarter of the Imperial Spire.) The tread of many a booted foot has flattened the rough earth into a wide path. A few stubborn clumps of weed cling tenaciously to the edge of the area, and a large dusty boulder on the west side of the path is the area's only other defining point. To the north, the remains of a once grand and ancient tree can be seen, marking the center of the arena. Bloated with blood and flesh, a frenzied bloodworm sets its beady eyes on you. A black, murky mist has settled here. Dripping with blood, an inverted pentagram floats in mid-air. The shadows bend and contort to the form of this nightmare, red eyes glaring from out of the darkness. Hovering on two scarlet leathery wings, this daemonite seems to have a vicious glint to its eyes. A black ouroboros oscillates endlessly here, staring at you with its many eyes. You see exits leading north, northeast, south, and northwest. L:3 A:0 P:0 &lt;296/296h 446/383m 1381e 1751w 20x &lt;-bpp&gt; &lt;bd&gt;&gt; You may drink another healing elixir. L:3 A:0 P:0 &lt;296/296h 446/383m 1381e 1754w 20x &lt;ebpp&gt; &lt;bd&gt;&gt; l A dirt path. (road). (Third quarter of the Imperial Spire.) The tread of many a booted foot has flattened the rough earth into a wide path. A few stubborn clumps of weed cling tenaciously to the edge of the area, and a large dusty boulder on the west side of the path is the area's only other defining point. To the north, the remains of a once grand and ancient tree can be seen, marking the center of the arena. Bloated with blood and flesh, a frenzied bloodworm sets its beady eyes on you. A black, murky mist has settled here. Dripping with blood, an inverted pentagram floats in mid-air. The shadows bend and contort to the form of this nightmare, red eyes glaring from out of the darkness. Hovering on two scarlet leathery wings, this daemonite seems to have a vicious glint to its eyes. A black ouroboros oscillates endlessly here, staring at you with its many eyes. You see exits leading north, northeast, south, and northwest. L:3 A:0 P:0 &lt;296/296h 446/383m 1381e 1754w 20x &lt;ebpp&gt; &lt;bd&gt;&gt; observe You pause a moment to observe the surrounding area. To the NORTH you see: Central combat area. (road). Buried deep to the hilt, the unmistakable shine of a longsword peaks out of the ground beneath. Blackened with use, bits and pieces of useless armour and weapons lie scattered about the area. Bloated with blood and flesh, a frenzied bloodworm sets its beady eyes on you. You see exits leading north, northeast, east, southeast, south, southwest, west, and northwest. To the NORTHEAST you see: Grassy hills. The area is ablaze! Bloated with blood and flesh, a frenzied bloodworm sets its beady eyes on you. Dripping with blood, an inverted pentagram floats in mid-air. You see exits leading north, southeast, southwest, and northwest. To the SOUTH you see: Grasslands near a stream. You see exits leading north, east, south, and west. To the NORTHWEST you see: Bridge over a waterfall. (road). The crushed translucent body of a bloodworm lies here in a pool of blood. L:3 A:0 P:0 &lt;296/296h 435/383m 1381e 1764w 20x &lt;ebpp&gt; &lt;bd&gt;&gt; l A dirt path. (road). (Third quarter of the Imperial Spire.) The tread of many a booted foot has flattened the rough earth into a wide path. A few stubborn clumps of weed cling tenaciously to the edge of the area, and a large dusty boulder on the west side of the path is the area's only other defining point. To the north, the remains of a once grand and ancient tree can be seen, marking the center of the arena. Bloated with blood and flesh, a frenzied bloodworm sets its beady eyes on you. A black, murky mist has settled here. Dripping with blood, an inverted pentagram floats in mid-air. The shadows bend and contort to the form of this nightmare, red eyes glaring from out of the darkness. Hovering on two scarlet leathery wings, this daemonite seems to have a vicious glint to its eyes. A black ouroboros oscillates endlessly here, staring at you with its many eyes. A stinking noxious cloud floats here. You see exits leading north, northeast, south, and northwest. (road). (Second quarter of the Imperial Spire.) This simple dirt area comprises the center of the arena. Heavy foot traffic has long since done away with most of the plants which might have once attempted to grow here, although a large, gnarled tree dominates the very center. It stands regally, though apparently dead and blackened for decades, it offers a convenient landmark which can be seen from most other areas of the arena. Buried deep to the hilt, the unmistakable shine of a longsword peaks out of the ground beneath. Blackened with use, bits and pieces of useless armour and weapons lie scattered about the area. Bloated with blood and flesh, a frenzied bloodworm sets its beady eyes on you. You see exits leading north, northeast, east, southeast, south, southwest, west, and northwest. L:3 A:0 P:0 &lt;296/296h 435/383m 1381e 1768w 20x &lt;ebpp&gt; &lt;bd&gt;&gt; l Central combat area. (road). (Second quarter of the Imperial Spire.) This simple dirt area comprises the center of the arena. Heavy foot traffic has long since done away with most of the plants which might have once attempted to grow here, although a large, gnarled tree dominates the very center. It stands regally, though apparently dead and blackened for decades, it offers a convenient landmark which can be seen from most other areas of the arena. Buried deep to the hilt, the unmistakable shine of a longsword peaks out of the ground beneath. Blackened with use, bits and pieces of useless armour and weapons lie scattered about the area. Bloated with blood and flesh, a frenzied bloodworm sets its beady eyes on you. Hovering on two scarlet leathery wings, this daemonite seems to have a vicious glint to its eyes. A black ouroboros oscillates endlessly here, staring at you with its many eyes. You see exits leading north, northeast, east, southeast, south, southwest, west, and northwest. L:3 A:0 P:0 &lt;296/296h 413/383m 1381e 1772w 20x &lt;ebpp&gt; &lt;bd&gt;&gt; p benzedrine Burnished to a shadowy ebon and brought to a soft sheen with careful treatment, this wooden vial has been made with the greatest skill. Carved expertly into the front of this vial is a needle pointed dirk, its razor sharp tip dug into the base of the vial. A sinous cobra winds its way around the blade, poised in a state of deceptive relaxation. In the pommel of this wicked death-dealer is an all seeing eye, the very center of which has been dyed a rich crimson. It has 201 months of usefulness left. It weighs 1 ounce(s). It bears the distinctive mark of Mistress Krysaliss Lynne, Shadow Dancer. The toxin benzedrine sloshes about in it. [Rat worth: 7] L:3 A:0 P:0 &lt;296/296h 413/383m 1381e 1781w 20x &lt;ebpp&gt; &lt;bd&gt;&gt; You may drink another healing elixir. L:3 A:0 P:0 &lt;296/296h 413/383m 1381e 1781w 20x &lt;ebpp&gt; &lt;bd&gt;&gt; wield daegger You begin to wield a wicked-looking daegger in your right hand. L:3 A:0 P:0 &lt;296/296h 413/383m 1381e 1782w 20x &lt;ebpp&gt; &lt;bd&gt;&gt; l Central combat area. (road). (Second quarter of the Imperial Spire.) This simple dirt area comprises the center of the arena. Heavy foot traffic has long since done away with most of the plants which might have once attempted to grow here, although a large, gnarled tree dominates the very center. It stands regally, though apparently dead and blackened for decades, it offers a convenient landmark which can be seen from most other areas of the arena. Buried deep to the hilt, the unmistakable shine of a longsword peaks out of the ground beneath. Blackened with use, bits and pieces of useless armour and weapons lie scattered about the area. Bloated with blood and flesh, a frenzied bloodworm sets its beady eyes on you. Hovering on two scarlet leathery wings, this daemonite seems to have a vicious glint to its eyes. A black ouroboros oscillates endlessly here, staring at you with its many eyes. Dripping with blood, an inverted pentagram floats in mid-air. The shadows bend and contort to the form of this nightmare, red eyes glaring from out of the darkness. A black, murky mist has settled here. You see exits leading north, northeast, east, southeast, south, southwest, west, and northwest. (anti-weapon field) You command your Ouroboros to tear the soul from Clark. Faster than the eye can follow, its blood-red hands shoot out and quickly burrow into the chest of Clark who begins screaming as his body bucks and convulses from the massive shock. Peeling back its lips to reveal its maw, the Ouroboros roars in triumph and rips its powerful arms backwards, dragging an ephemeral, spiderweb substance with it: Clark's soul. You have slain Clark. The image of Clark blurs, fading to a green nebula as vanishes to the ether. You look around triumphantly and realize you are the last one standing. You have WON the combat free-for-all.
